New Records: Tarik Skubal reached 200 strikeouts in a season, becoming the fourth Tigers lefty to achieve this milestone, joining Mickey Lolich, Hal Newhouser, and Matthew Boyd.
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal pitched a career-high eight innings, allowing just one run and striking out eight batters.
Riley Greene threw out Romy Gonzalez at second base after he tried to stretch a single into a double.
Zach McKinstry and Trey Sweeney turned an improbable double play on a high-chopper by Triston Casas.
Ryan Kreidler made a difficult play at third base to retire Triston Casas in the eighth inning.
The Tigers scored two runs in the second inning with hits from Spencer Torkelson, Zach McKinstry, and Trey Sweeney.
Pre-Game Insights: The game had a special atmosphere as fans came early to celebrate the 40-year anniversary of the 1984 World Series championship.
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal expressed his excitement about the milestone and the support from fans.
Spencer Torkelson praised Skubal's conviction and confidence in his pitches.
Manager AJ Hinch highlighted the importance of aggressive base running and praised the team's defensive plays.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers are six losses behind the Twins for the final wild card spot and are 1½ games behind the Red Sox and a game behind the Mariners.
